version.title: Crox, Can You Hear Me?
version.header: Yeep. Well, something went wrong with a stock provider recently. Plus, new feature anyway!

bullets.bullet: Changed the stock price provider to give priority to Peeron over Crox. Crox went kerflooey over the weekend, apparently, and did so in a way my code wasn't expecting. Sorry about that.

The stock pre-fetcher will now start at boot time (if you have it turned on to begin with)! No more starting up Geohash Droid once after a reboot just to make sure it notifies you if a point is nearby!

version.footer: The stock provider fix is a temporary thing. I'm going to have to come up with a more robust way to handle fallbacks in that case.

version.title: Boldly Looking Forward
version.header: Here's a small bug I missed:

bullets.bullet: Fixed an issue where if you use Last Used Graticule as the startup mode and there wasn't a stock price posted yet when you checked, changing the date wouldn't trigger a new stock lookup unless you also changed the graticule. Now it'll remember the graticule it started with and do things right.

version.title: The Old Backup Plan
version.header: Have some updates and minor feature cleanups!

bullets.bullet: The popup that reminds you that you need to turn on stock pre-fetching to use known locations now has a third button, one that directly goes to the Other Options section of Preferences so that you can change that right away.

The initial zoom on the known locations picker will now try to make sure all the range rings are fully on-screen. That should fix some odd cases where it opens to a map where those rings spill way off the screen.
Added in proper preference backup stuff for pre-Marshmallow devices. Backups should've already been working on Marshmallow.
Updated HttpClient to newer, fresher libraries for newer, fresher wiki posting and stock fetching.

version.title: That Familiar Place Down The Street
version.header: It's version 0.9.1! There's a lot going on here! Check it out:

bullets.bullet: There's a known locations system now! Accessible through the Map Options part of Preferences, you can now add in locations that you consider to be "known". If stock pre-fetching is on, those points will be checked for any nearby hashpoints (you can restrict each to its respective home Graticule) or the globalhash for the day, and you'll get a notification if anything's close enough.

Remember how the pre-0.9.0 versions started with the Graticule selection screen and also remembered the last Graticule you used? Now there's a preference (again, in Map Options) to have Geohash Droid start with either of those, rather than the default of picking the nearest hashpoint regardless of which Graticule it's in!

In the options menu on the main expedition map, there's a brand new "Try Tomorrow" option. That'll increment the date to tomorrow, just in case you wanted to check the entire weekend's worth of hashpoints quickly on a Friday.
The InfoBox will now fade out if either your location or the final destination are directly underneath it. Easier to see that way.
Fixed the fact that stock pre-fetching wasn't actually working the way it should have been.
Updates to Play Services.
The usual sort of minor fixes and such.

version.footer: The Known Locations system is the big thing here. I did as much testing as I reasonably could, and I think it'll work the way I'm expecting it to, but there might be some glitches. Let me know (in GitHub) if something's really wrong with it.

version.title: Where The Streets Have No Name, And In Fact Aren't Even Shown On The Map
version.header: One minor feature and one bug fix later...

bullets.bullet: Geohash Droid will now remember the last map type you chose (street, satellite, terrain) and default to that when you start the app.
Fixed a bug where if you were in expedition mode (the main mode, where you're not picking a Graticule) with an active Globalhash, it wasn't recognizing if you changed the active date.

version.footer: 0.9.1 might be right around the corner.

version.title: -nodpi Means -nodpi
version.header: Did you know the -nodpi resource qualifier is sometimes ignored in certain cases? I didn't!

bullets.bullet: Fixed an issue where sometimes the icons used to build up the infobox on wiki posts came out really really huge.
The stock prefetch notification is now dismissable, in the rare event that it doesn't go away for some reason.

version.footer: More actual features to come once I've reworked a few things.

version.title: Picking Up The Fragments
version.header: This should cover a slightly different device-specific issue.

bullets.bullet: Fixed the Graticule picker box not showing up on all devices.
Also made the same picker more robust on devices where it DID show up.
It also animates more smoothly.

version.footer: Once again, thanks to George McBane for the help with tracking this down and making sure it was working.

version.title: Infinite Diversity In Infinite Combinations
version.header: Hopefully this bug didn't affect you, but if it did...

bullets.bullet: Fixed an issue where the stock price wasn't being properly downloaded for users of some Android devices.
Or some firmwares.
Or maybe some runtime environments.
Point is, it should hopefully be working right now.

version.footer: Thanks to George McBane for running tests on his phone to help me nail this one down.

version.title: Maybe Not ALL Of Google Play Services
version.header: Just a minor update this time.

bullets.bullet: Trimmed down the amount of Google Play APIs used. This should cut things down a bit and allows me to mark Geohash Droid as ad-free on the store without complaints. It also means the app won't have that odd "Accounts" permission switch that never gets used.
Updated to version 8.3.0 of the Play Services I DO use.

version.footer: Let me know if I missed any permissions checks that the new Play Services need.

version.title: A New Day Dawns Over The 30W Line
version.header: It's here! It's here! The revamped Geohash Droid is finally here! Seriously, just look at this:

bullets.bullet: Completely redone Fragment-based, materials-ish interface. Your tablet will thank you.
Brand-new Google Maps v2 API. Navigate in comfort and style!
Marshmallow permissions, where appropriate.
All wiki calls are in the background, so you can queue up multiple requests if you don't have an internet connection.
Fixed the problem where you couldn't post to the wiki for a while regardless. Whoops.
Newer, crisper graphics.

version.footer: This version should work basically as well as the previous 0.7 versions. If something goes wrong, file issues at the GitHub repository. Now, hopefully I can get some NEW features going...
